think_procedure.step2: Understand the normal operation of 'checkpoint_segments', which is to specify the maximum number of log file segments between automatic WAL checkpoints.
think_procedure.step3: Research if 'checkpoint_segments' has any special values that alter its normal operation.
think_procedure.step4: Discover that in PostgreSQL versions prior to 9.5, 'checkpoint_segments' could be set to -1 to disable the automatic checkpointing based on the number of segments, relying instead on the 'checkpoint_timeout' setting.
think_procedure.step5: Conclude that 'checkpoint_segments' is a special knob due to its ability to disable a feature when set to a special value.
